summary: Seasoned education professional with over 30 years of experience in guidance and counseling. Led the Guidance & Counseling Unit across the Bahamas, supervised hundreds of counselors, and developed advanced school counseling programs in collaboration with higher education institutions. Expertise includes crisis and employee counseling, program development, staff training, and implementing the Employee Assistance Program (EAP).
skills: Resistance and Prevention Program (RAPP) certified trainer
Knowledge of Erik Erikson developmental stages

experience.title: Office Clerk
experience.description: Early career role within the Ministry of Education.

experience.title: School Counselor
experience.description: Provided individual and group counseling; posted at R.M. Bailey; progressed to leadership roles within the Guidance Department.

experience.title: Head of the Guidance Department
experience.description: Led the Guidance Department; supervised 42 to 132 counselors across 94 schools; collaborated on national counseling initiatives.

experience.title: Education Officer & Senior Education Officer, Guidance & Counseling Unit
experience.description: Supervised Guidance Counselors across the Bahamas; developed comprehensive school counseling programs; established crisis team; initiated and expanded the Employee Assistance Program (EAP).

experience.title: Adjunct Lecturer
experience.company: Kent State University & The College of the Bahamas
experience.description: Taught and contributed to the Masters in School Counseling program offered at Nassau Campus.

experience.title: Employee Assistance Program Coordinator
experience.description: Designed and implemented the Employee Assistance Program for Ministry of Education staff; expanded program to serve all government employees; led ongoing development and expansion efforts.

education.degree: Master of Science in Guidance Counseling
